decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle land card to deal lethal damage by searching for multiple Mountain cards and playing a Scapeshift spell to sacrifice those lands and bring in more Mountains, triggering Valakut's ability multiple times to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck also includes ramp cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Explore to accelerate the process of getting the required lands on the battlefield, while also including Primeval Titan as another win condition by searching for Valakut and Mountains.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By combining cards like Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek to create an army of flying tokens, along with control elements like Pithing Needle and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Urza, Lord High Artificer serves as a powerful engine to generate mana and card advantage, while cards like Whir of Invention and Detention Sphere provide additional utility and answers to threats. The deck aims to grind out the opponent and secure the win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements combined with efficient creatures and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also applying pressure. By leveraging cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Spell Queller, and Stoneforge Mystic, the deck aims to control the game and establish a board presence to close out the match. The inclusion of versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, along with powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine, provides flexibility and resilience against a variety of strategies.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage through card draw and planeswalkers. It aims to survive the early game with counterspells and removal, then stabilize with powerful threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler. Stoneforge Mystic provides additional value by tutoring equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine. The deck's mana base ensures consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Life from the Loam, then use cards like Conflagrate and Creeping Chill to deal damage directly from the graveyard. Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast provide additional value by returning to the battlefield from the graveyard. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of graveyard recursion and direct damage, creating a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle. The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource and using it to win the game efficiently.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also leveraging powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six to control the board. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. With a mix of disruption, removal, and threats, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm opponents in the early and mid-game to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly casting powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. Utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Thought Scour to lower your life total and fill your graveyard, you can gain advantage with Snapcaster Mage and delve creatures. Stubborn Denial provides protection for your threats, while removal spells like Dismember and Fatal Push keep the board clear. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies. It aims to assemble the Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combo to generate a constant stream of token creatures and gain life. Urza, Lord High Artificer provides mana acceleration and card advantage. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to disrupt the opponent's plays while Whir of Invention tutors for key artifacts. The deck also includes control elements like Ensnaring Bridge and Pithing Needle to slow down aggressive strategies and protect key pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategies through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, as well as equipment like Batterskull and swords for additional value. With a mix of efficient counterspells and removal, the deck aims to stabilize the board and then win the game through attrition and incremental advantage. The mana base is designed to support the control game plan and provide consistent access to the deck's powerful spells.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a board of disruptive and evasive Spirit creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Mausoleum Wanderer and Spell Queller to counter opponent spells while Supreme Phantom pumps up the team. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for quickly deploying creatures at instant speed, keeping the pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes some control elements like Deputy of Detention and Path to Exile to handle threats. Overall, the deck aims to establish an aggressive presence while maintaining some control over the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful Eldrazi creatures in combination with efficient mana ramp and disruption cards to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Karn, the Great Creator, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to put early pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Dismember. With Urza lands providing mana acceleration and consistency, the Eldrazi Aggro deck seeks to win the game before the opponent can stabilize or establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up its own resources, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful planeswalkers and finishers like Celestial Colonnade. The deck utilizes a mix of reactive spells like Path to Exile and Spell Snare, as well as proactive threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent in the long game.

The deck focuses on ramping mana quickly through Amulet of Vigor and various land bounce lands, allowing for explosive plays with cards like Primeval Titan and Summoner's Pact. It also utilizes utility lands such as Slayers' Stronghold and Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion to give creatures additional abilities and increase their power. The deck includes engines like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Karn, the Great Creator to further enhance its combo potential. Ultimately, the key concept of this deck is to assemble the pieces needed to get Primeval Titan out quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful land-based creatures and abilities.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly lower your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow, while also using disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble to cycle through your deck and fuel delve creatures like Gurmag Angler. Additionally, the deck has a few versatile removal options in Fatal Push, Dismember, and Kolaghan's Command to handle threats on the other side of the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through aggressive creatures and direct burn spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear alongside powerful burn spells like Boros Charm and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to burn down the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. With additional support from cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze, the deck's aggressive strategy is further reinforced. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the overall game plan while providing consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a board full of artifact creatures while utilizing cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast to pump up damage and take out threats. Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer are key in buffing up the team, while Vault Skirge provides lifelink to keep you in the game. Experimental Frenzy allows you to keep playing cards from the top of your library, maximizing your resources. The deck excels in fast, aggressive plays and overwhelming your opponent with a flurry of artifact creatures and buffs.
